Documentation¶

Inheritance Diagram¶

Description¶

This module implements the SocialNetworkClass class which models the population and the associated social network in out HIV model. It contains the following classes:

  • PopulationClass – Class describing the population.
  • SocialNetworkClass – Class modeling the social network.
  • HIVModel – Class modeling the evolution of our poplulation.

Reference¶

PopulationClass¶

class HIVABM_Population.PopulationClass(n=10000)[source]¶
Purpose :

This class constructs and represents the model population
Input :
n : int

Number of agents. Default: 10000
Attributes :
PopulationSize : int

Size of the population.

propIDU : float

Prevalence of intravenous drug users.

numIDU : int

Number of intravenous drug users.

propNIDU : float

Prevalence of non-intravenous drug users.

numNIDU : int

Number of non-intravenous drug users.

propND : float

Prevalence of not drug users.

numND : int

Number of not drug users.

Agents: dict

Dictionary of agents and their characteristics. The agents are the `keys’ and a dicotionary of ‘characteristic:value’ pair is the entry.

IDU_agents: list

IDU drug users

NIDU_agents: list

NIDU drug users

ND_agents: list

ND drug users

MSM_agents: list

MSM agents

HIV_agents: list

HIV+ users

AIDS_agents: list

Users with AIDS

SocialNetworkClass¶

class HIVABM_Network.SocialNetworkClass(N=10000, m_0=3)[source]¶

Bases: HIVABM_Population.PopulationClass

Purpose :

This class inherits from the class PopulationClass. It therefore inherits the population and embeds all agents in a random social network.
Input :
N : int

Number of agents. Default: 10000

m_0: int

Number of nodes each node is connected to in preferential attachment step

PopulationClass : Inherited
Attributes :

G : networkX graph object pool_of_similar_nodes

repeated_nodes

repeated_nodes_IDU

repeated_nodes_NIDU

repeated_nodes_ND

repeated_nodes_HIV

All attributes from PopulationClass

Evolution¶

class HIVABM_Evolution.HIVModel(N=10000, tmax=40)[source]¶

Bases: HIVABM_Population.PopulationClass

Purpose :

This is the core class used to simulate the spread of HIV and drug use in one MSA (Metropolitan Statistical Area).
Input :
N : int

Number of agents. Default: 10000

tmax: int

Number of simulation steps (years).

SocialNetworkClass : Inherited

PopulationClass : Inherited
Attributes :
tmax : int

Number of time steps simulated.

CleanSyringeUsers : list

SafeSexUsers : dict

Dictionary of users who had safe sex {agent:time}.

SEPAgents : dict

Dictionary of users who participated in a syringe exchange program (SEP) {agent:time}.

DrugTreatmentAgents : dict

Dictionary of users who underwent drug treatment {agent:time}.

TestedAgents : list

List of agents who get tested for HIV every time step.

tmp_Agents : dict

Changes resulting from parsing through the agents and applying the update rules are stored in tmp_agent_dict.

All attributes from SocialNetworkClass

All attributes from PopulationClass

_update_population()[source]¶
Purpose :Update the population. Changes resulting from parsing through the agents and applying the update rules are stored in tmp_agent_dict. This method updates the whole population, i.e., it copies changes from the tmp_agent_dict dictionary and copies it into the Agents dictionary.
Input :none
Output :none
_needle_transmission(agent, partner)[source]¶
Purpose :

Simulate random transmission of HIV between two IDU agents through needle.

Needed in _update_IDUand
Input :

agents : int partner : int
Output :
_sex_transmission(agent, partner, time)[source]¶
Purpose :

Simulate random transmission of HIV between two agents through Sex. Needed for all users. Sex is not possible in case the agent and assigned partner have incompatible Sex behavior.
Input :

agents : int partner : int time : int
Output :
_drug_transition(agent, partner)[source]¶
Purpose :

Simulate transition of drug behavior. The following scenarios are possible: + ND agent might become NIDU when meeting NIDU + NIDU might become IDU when meeting IDU The function is only applied for NIDU and ND users.
Input :

agents : int partner : int
Output :
_update_IDU(agent, partner, time)[source]¶
Purpose :

Let IDU agent interact with a partner. Update IDU agents:

1 - determine transition type 2 - Injection rules 3 - Sex rules 4 - HIV transmission 5 - SEP
Input :

agent : int

partner : int

time : int
Output:
none
_update_NIDU_ND(agent, partner, time)[source]¶
Purpose :Let NIDU or ND agent interact.
Input :agent : int partner : int time : int

Output: none

_VCT(agent, time)[source]¶
Purpose :Account for voluntary Counseling and Testing(VCT)
Input :agent : int partner : int time : int
Output :none
_SEP(agent, time)[source]¶
Purpose :

Account for SEP (Syringe Exchange Program) for IDU agents.

SEP use depends on the year and the functional relationship is given by P(SEP USE (t+1) | IDU) = P(SEP USE (t) | IDU)*f_t(SEP density) where f_t(SEP density) = (1+? + ln(?))
Input :

time : int
Output :

bool
_initiate_HAART(agent, time)[source]¶
Purpose :Account for HIV treatment through highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART). HAART was implemented in 1996, hence, there is treatment only after 1996. HIV treatment assumes that the agent knows his HIV+ status.
Input :time : int
Output :none
_update_AllAgents(time)[source]¶
Purpose :

Update IDU agents:

For each agent:

1 - determine agent type 2 - update accordingly 3 - VCT (Voluntsry Counseling and Testing)
Input :

agent, time
Output :

none

Core of the model :param agent: agent
